https://ajpaction.org/hotline.userSummary: Access support for U.S. citizens facing issues such as detainment or denial of entry at Israeli borders or in the Occupied Palestinian Territories.
https://ajpaction.org/hotline.og_description:
need help?If you or a loved one face any mistreatment by Israeli authorities and need support, please reach out to AJP Action's Israeli Discrimination hotline by dialing (844) 939-0921		
		why?This hotline has been created to support Palestinian Americans, or any U.S. citizen, in navigating challenges (detainment, denial of entry, etc.) faced at the Israeli borders or within the occupied territories. In addition to doing our best to support any victims of discrimination, we find it crucial to collect any data on Israel's discrimination against Palestinian, Arab, and Muslim Americans and any American vocal on Palestinian human rights. Watch our video explainer below to learn more:		
		https://youtu.be/yWXVaaKGPjcIncident Report FormPlease fill out the form below and a member of our staff will be in contact with you.(Disclaimer: As Israel works to be admitted into the Visa Waiver Program, it's important for all discrimination at ports of entry to be recorded. In addition to filling out our form, please fill out the  U.S. embassy's form as well).		
 

















1. Are you a U.S. citizen?
YesNo


2. Do you have a U.S. passport?
YesNo


3. Date of Birth



4. Did you experience any act of discrimination or denial of entry at an Israeli border crossing, airport, seaport, or checkpoint?
YesNo


5. If you experienced an act of discrimination at an Israeli border crossing, airport, or checkpoint, please describe your experience. Make sure to including the following details: location, time, date, names of Israeli agencies or individuals (including position) involved. Also include any biographic data that you think is relevant to the discrimination including, but not limited to, your ethnicity, nationality or religion.





6. If you were denied entry, were you provided with a reason for denial?
Yes, I was provided with a letter explaining why I was denied.Yes, I was verbally told why I was denied.No, I do not know why I was denied.I was not denied entry.


7. Do you give AJP Action permission to report this incident to the U.S. Department of State and/or Homeland Security?
YesNoPlease contact me first to discuss

	
	
Δ

		help othersKnow anyone who can benefit from our hotline and has recently suffered Israeli treatment while trying to enter or move within Palestine and the occupied territories? Be sure to share it with them and spread the word!

https://www.hrw.org/report/2023/12/21/me.userSummary: A Human Rights Watch report examining Meta's (Instagram) censorship of Palestinian content and its impact on free speech and content moderation.
https://www.hrw.org/report/2023/12/21/me.og_description: The 51-page report, “Meta’s Broken Promises: Systemic Censorship of Palestine Content on Instagram and Facebook,” documents a pattern of undue removal and suppression of protected speech including peaceful expression in support of Palestine and public debate about Palestinian human rights. Human Rights Watch found that the problem stems from flawed Meta policies and their inconsistent and erroneous implementation, overreliance on automated tools to moderate content, and undue government influence over content removals.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1.userSummary: A database of scholarships for Palestinians, including opportunities for study and research abroad.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQ.userSummary: A collection of initiatives offering scholarships and scientific missions for Palestinian academics and students to study or research in Western universities.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQ.og_title: Initiatives to support Palestinian students, academics and universities 🍉🍓
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQ.og_description:
Below is a list of initiatives and resources to support Palestinian students, academics and universities (please see below), particularly in the UK and Ireland. Please use the form below to add to this list, and please share widely. 

Please note, the purpose of this form is for organisations to share information about initiatives / resources so that they can be added to the list below. I am unable to respond to requests from individuals who are looking for scholarships, fellowships, etc. However: 
if you are a Gazan student looking to complete your studies, please refer to the links in the list below and email the relevant contacts directly. If you require support identifying suitable opportunities, you can request this by contacting Mosaik Education via this form or the Gazan Student Support Network for support via this form or the Amal Initiative via this form. If you require help applying for a scholarship, plus support with visa/travel practicalities, you can contact the Gaza Scholarship Initiative for Displaced Students via this form
If you are a Gazan academic looking for a fellowship, please refer to the section related to fellowships in the list below
Thanks in advance - Aleks Palanac

Scholarships (f2f) specifically for Palestinian students​
Dr Maisara Alrayyes Scholarship at King's College London
Crisis Scholarship Scheme at Jesus College, Oxford
Dima Alhaj Scholarship at University of Glasgow
British Council’s HESPAL Programme​
Palestine Community Foundation and British Council – list of scholarships​ via Chevening, Said Foundation, Oxford Brookes, Durham, St Andrews and more
Connect Palestine's scholarships database
Durham Palestine Educational Trust Master's Scholarships
Herriott Watt PhD scholarships
St Andrews Education for Palestinian Students (STEPS) Scholarships
Queen's University Belfast Scholarship
Uni of Sheffield Gaza-Palestine Postgraduate Taught Scholarship
Uni of Dundee Occupied Palestinian Territories search tool
Salam Scholarships at Ulster University (for 5 Palestinian women per year)
Queen's University Belfast's Copty Scholarship (applications now closed for Sept 2024 entry)
Shireen Abu Akleh MA Scholarship in Palestine Studies at University of Exeter 
Goldsmiths' Humanitarian Scholarship
Ireland-Palestine Scholarship Programme (Master's level study)
Scholarships for Palestinians in Hungary
Scholarships for Palestinians in Germany
University of Padua (Italy) Students at Risk Scholarships
Daughters for Life Foundation scholarships for women from Palestine and a few other countries in the Middle East to study in Europe/Canada
Scholarship for 5-year architecture programme at the Albukhary Foundation in London - these are also open to students from Palestine who can commit to the full 5 years. Fees and accommodation are all paid
Tanya Baker-Asad Scholarship (for Palestinian women pursuing PhDs)
Bseisu Foundation Scholarships
Manuel Fernandez Scholarship for Girls from Gaza (this is a link to a fundraising page to generate funds for this scholarship)
PhD scholarship in the Cultures of Palestinian Solidarity in Europe (at Maastricht University, Netherlands)
Organisation of Southern Cooperation (OSC) Scholarships -  the State of Palestine is a Member State of the Organisation of Southern Cooperation which is offering 400 scholarships for postgraduate study to all students who come from the Member States
SOAS Centre for Palestine Studies Master's Scholarship
https://www.centeraap.org/gaza-scholarship-fund-for-displaced-students/ - Gaza Scholarship Fund for Displaced Students (from the Center for Arab-American Philanthropy)
Amideast's Hope Fund - this is a scholarship fund for young Palestinians with leadership potential to pursue undergraduate degrees in the Unites States
Dutch Scholars for Palestine's list of scholarships for Palestinian students (in the Netherlands)
Scholarships (f2f) open to UK asylum seekers (incl. Palestinian asylum seekers)
University of Manchester Article 26 Scholarship and also their Humanitarian Scholarship
University of Liverpool Humanitarian Scholarships for Master's Programmes
University of Leicester Sanctuary Scholarship
University of Edinburgh's Education Beyond Borders Displaced Student Scholarships (Master's level)
Kings College London Sanctuary Scholarship (Pathway 3) - these fully funded scholarships are for all levels of study, including the International Foundation year, and they are open to Palestinians with a range of immigration statuses
University of York's Equal Access Scholarships (undergraduate and post-graduate)
Many more UK Sanctuary Scholarships are available via the searchable Displaced Student Opportunities UK website
Scholarships (Distance Learning - open to Palestinians inside or outside UK)​
University of Leicester ​
University of London​
New School of the Anthropocene
Online English language tutoring
ELT Professionals for Palestine runs an online language tutoring programme where they match volunteer teachers to Palestinian adults to teach them English online. Please email Fatima at tutoringeltforpalestine@gmail.com for further information or to apply

Fellowships
Safe Haven Fellowships
CARA fellowships (which are also available to Palestinian academics)
Scholar Rescue Fund fellowships
British Council 90th Anniversary Research Fellowships at University of Edinburgh (open to scholars from countries that receive ODA funds in which the British Council operates, which includes Palestine)
Max Planck Institute Fellowship Programme for researchers from Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories
Dutch Scholars for Palestine's list of Fellowships for Palestinian researchers (in the Netherlands)
Other initiatives (some current and some in the pipeline)​
Emergency Committee for Universities in Gaza - this is a coalition of Gazan universities established in order to articulate the needs and priorities of Gazan universities
Open letter from Gazan academics and university administrators to the world - this is an important call from Gazan universities to push back against any educational initiatives that are not developed in consultation with Gazan universities themselves, and which contribute to the scholasticide and erasure of agency and identity of the Gazan people
TESI initiative (led by An-Najah National University in the West Bank) to help Gazan students complete degrees (tesi@najah.edu)​
Gaza Scholarship Initiative for Displaced Students - this network of volunteers is helping Gazan students apply for scholarships and gather the documentation they need in order to be able to take these scholarships up. Students can apply to be added to their list via this form. Organisations can contact the GSI team by emailing Aisha Mershani at amershani@gmail.com and/or Michelle Lerner at lernermichelle@aol.com
Scholarships for Ghazza Mentors - if you are able to volunteer to mentor students from Gaza find and apply for a scholarship, please fill in this form
Birzeit University's Rebuilding Hope initiative
Academic Solidarity with Palestine -  ASP is gathering a team of professors able to teach Gaza students online, in English or Arabic. They are looking for faculty in all subjects. They are also looking for graduate students willing to act as TAs (academicsolidaritywithpalestine@proton.me /  @__aswp)
Open Educational Resources (OERs) for Gaza -  a form to collate info about open ed. resources to support Gazan students to continue their studies
Academics for Gaza  (A4G) has gathered an international network of volunteer scholars from diverse academic backgrounds to provide online tutoring sessions, seminars, and tailor-made lectures to the students of Gaza, addressing specific needs of students. See their Facebook page and/or email them for more info: academics4Gaza@gmail.com
OxPal initiative to support Gazan medical students to complete their studies (Dr. Shameq Sayeed: shameq.sayeed@leicester.ac.uk)​
Twinning arrangements (via Cormack Consultancy Group)​
Architects for Gaza are calling for the establishment of a Gaza Global University
Gaza Educate Medics (GEM) - this is a scheme run by the PalMed Academy to enable Gazan medical students to complete their medical degrees (Mahmoud Loubani - loubani@gemedu.online)
Campus France (an organisation facilitating study in France from a range of countries, including the Occupied Palestinian Territories)
Article 26 Backpack - The Universal Human Rights Tool for Academic Mobility (a way for students to safely store and share information about their educational history with universities and other organisations)
Palestinian Students Scholarship Fund - this organisation works with partner universities to fund scholarships for Palestinian students (currently in Canada, but soon also in the US and Europe), providing: matching with a supervisor, admission, funding guarantee, visa application, relocation, and psychosocial support
Accountability Archive -  this is a crowdsourced record of journalists, politicians, and public figures endorsing or encouraging the ethnic cleansing of Gaza and/or defaming pro-Palestinian activists, for use by future historians (accountabilityarchive@proton.me)
Hebron University's initiative to enable Gazan students to continue their studies online (application form in Arabic)
Fundraisers for educational initiatives
TESI initiative (to enable Gazan students to complete their degrees via distance learning) - they are asking for donations via this form to support the building of infrastructure and, where possible, help sustain Gazan academics who are volunteering to teach on this project
British Society for Middle Eastern Studies (BRISMES) fund to support the survival and rebuilding of HE in Gaza
Sumud: Rebuilding home, street and neighbourhood - fundraising initiative by Architects for Gaza,  Office of Displaced Designers and Global Free Unit, who are working on creating a Gaza Global University
Trauma and psycho-social support - training and resources
Trauma-informed ESOL for Refugees by Aleks Palanac (self-access training, including videos, activities and reading material, taking between 1-4 hours to complete). Although the focus is nominally ESOL, this is applicable to anyone teaching refugee-background students who have experienced trauma. Scroll down to 'self-access training' to access this free resource
Trauma Informed Practice training by Nicola Lester (free-self-access training and resources at Bronze, Silver and Gold levels)
Inter-agency Network for Education in Emergencies webinar on Psycho-Social Support for Students in Gaza (held on 8/4/24) and Psycho-Social Support and Socio-Emotional Learning Toolbox
Other useful links / resources
Networks and information pages​
Scholars for Palestine UK​
Scholars Against the War on Palestine + Scholasticide Toolkit
Rebuilding Hope: Birzeit University and HE in Gaza
British Committee for the Universities of Palestine (BRICUP)
UCU guide to scholarships for Palestinian students​
UCU’s Ceasefire Now info page
ELT Professionals for Palestine (LinkedIn, Facebook, Insta)
Horizons Academy (a Palestinian organisation supporting Palestinian students to find scholarships)
Association of Student Activism for Palestine -  ASAP International Students Project: provides comprehensive support to international Palestinian students in the UK, assisting with accommodation, networking, and other essential needs. Requests for scholarships or funding are not currently in scope of this initiative
The Bridge Directory - connecting Gazans to organisations which can provide support
Inter-Agency Network for Education in Emergencies (INEE)
The Palestine Academy - learning resources about the situation in Palestine and guidelines about how to support the Palestinian cause through collective social media activism
Workers in Palestine - an association of over 30 Palestinian Trades Unions and professional associations calling for an end to the genocide (including an end to all complicity in the genocide, occupation and apartheid)
Verso's free e-books on Palestine, mass protests and student rebellions
Dutch Scholars for Palestine
Electronic Intifada - website and podcast
Articles
A Second Nakba by Dr. Joseph Choonara (an article in International Socialism Journal from Dec 2023, giving a comprehensive overview of the context of the current situation in Gaza)
Compare: A Journal of International and Comparative Education - Special Collection on Palestine and Israel
BAICE Compare Podcast episode entitled Between construction and destruction: the experience of educationalists at Gaza’s universities (interview with Palestinian academic Dr. Mona Jebril)
Efforts to support Palestinian scientists struggle with the realities of war (article in Science by Amanda Heidt)

Webinars/talks

Upcoming events:


Recordings of events which have already taken place:
recording of a session on How can UK universities support HE in Palestine? (as part of University of Leicester's Breaking Barriers Refugee Week 2024)
recording of a talk by Dr Victoria Araj on Educide in Palestine (organised by The Centre for the Study of Social and Global Justice)
recording of webinar organised by Scholars for Palestine UK entitled Confronting Genocide in Palestine: The Role of UK Scholars and Beyond
recording of RefugEAP Network webinar on English for Academic Purposes Collaborations with Gazan Universities: Insights from the EAST Project (held on 25/4/24 with Dr Bill Guariento presenting)
Dutch-language recording of a lecture about Gaza for the Erasmus University Rotterdam Honours Law College on 5/4/24
webinar to outline the Gaza Educate Medics (GEM) scheme (run by PalMed Academy and held on 9/3/24)
Friends of Birzeit University's (Fobzu) Education-Occupation-Liberation series of event recordings of lectures and seminars, focusing on the challenges facing Palestinian education

Campaigns: petitions and open letters
Palacademic campaign to extend the British Academy's Researchers at Risk scheme to Palestinian academics (and a template letter to urge your MP to support an Early Day Motion on this issue)
petition to create a UK visa scheme for Palestinians fleeing the conflict (and an open letter template to write to MPs to support an Early Day Motion on this issue)
Oxfam's petition for an immediate ceasefire in the Gaza strip
BRICUP's Academic Commitment for Palestine (open letter for academics to commit to an academic boycott)
Models from other countries
A useful list of initiatives/resources in various countries compiled by Comité pour la Liberté d'Expression Scientifique
Palestinian Students and Scholars at Risk (Canada based)
Gazan Student Support Network (US based)

https://forms.gle/Wm8iF6vuExvA5TeZ9.userSummary: A form for collecting data on workplace retaliation against Pro-Palestinian advocates, to help validate and quantify the issue and provide legal resources.
https://forms.gle/Wm8iF6vuExvA5TeZ9.og_title: The Israel-Gaza Conflict at the Workplace
https://forms.gle/Wm8iF6vuExvA5TeZ9.og_description:
The Israel-Gaza conflict is stirring up divisive conversations within American workplaces, creating stress for both workers and those in charge.  The core of the issue: pro-Palestinian workers are feeling like their pain isn't being acknowledged, and they fear retaliation at work. Meanwhile, Jewish staffers are feeling concerns over growing anti-semitism.

If you consider yourself either pro-Palestinian or pro-Israeli, we would like to know what impact this has had on your safe space at work. We believe everyone should have a safe space at work. We hope this data can help companies better achieve that.

https://markoliver2.gumroad.com/l/Palest.userSummary: Obsidian research notes based on the book 'The Ethnic Cleansing of Palestine.'
https://markoliver2.gumroad.com/l/Palest.og_title: Research notes of "the ethnic cleansing of Palestine" book
https://markoliver2.gumroad.com/l/Palest.og_description: Research notes of "the ethnic cleansing of Palestine" bookWhen I was reading the book, I decided to take notes over the characters, events and different quotes and link them by an app called Obsidian. This made the journey of learning the history of Palestine easier to understand and to know more about different characters and fields.This research note will have:brief introduction about all the characters and their context in the book as quotesPlaces of Palestinian villages and what happened to itbrief introduction of historic eventsOthers may include references, book names or events that are not related to the main topicHow do you access it?To access it, you need to download a notes app called "Obsidian". It's a note-taking app that links notes with each other to make a "knowledge base" of information that is easier to understand. The requirements areDownloading Obsidian through the PCextracting the research notes fileOpening the file from Obsidian as a vault There's a PDF version for everyone who can't work on obsidian
